alert.note: Alert for Butte; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 11:14AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Idaho... Antelope Creek near Darlington affecting Butte and Custer Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Antelope Creek near Darlington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding possible along stretches of Antelope Creek from the Grouse area downsteram to the Big Lost River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Saturday was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 05/26/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Antelope Creek Darlington 6.0 6.1 Sat 10 am MD MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
